shortlist.name: Bird Of War (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Bird Of War is the only runner with single-figure odds on both sportsbook and exchange, indicating strong market confidence. The latest run (4th) suggests improvement and potential to peak now. Connections are respected, and the booking of Jason Watson is a positive. No major negatives in the profile, and the form is competitive for this grade.

shortlist.name: Supreme Dancer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid second-favorite, some drift on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Supreme Dancer is consistently hitting the frame, with recent 2nd and 4th place finishes showing reliability at this level. Richard Fahey is a capable trainer, and the horse's profile suggests he is holding form. Exchange drift is a slight concern but still within a competitive range. Should be thereabouts if repeating recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Storm Esme
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.04, SBK 5/6 – clear market leader after NR
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, then ran below expectations in a stronger race; returns to a more suitable level and is the only runner with proven winning form. Market support is strong, and connections are reliable. No major improvement needed, and profile fits a typical short-priced winner in this grade.

shortlist.name: White Island (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5.1, SBK 7/2 – solid second choice in market
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in recent starts, showing ability to place at this level. Has not needed major improvement to be competitive and is well found in the market. Represents a stable with a good record in similar races. Should be thereabouts if the favorite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Figjam (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support: 1/2 SBK, 1.82 exchange (clear favourite after non-runner)
shortlist.rationale: Figjam is the clear market leader with solid recent form, placing second and fourth in two starts, indicating reliability and progression. The odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange, and the absence of Nala's Dream (the original favourite) further strengthens Figjam's position. Connections are competent, and the horse does not require major improvement to win in this field[1][4][5].

shortlist.name: Whizzy Dizzy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market: 10/3 SBK, 5 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Whizzy Dizzy is the next best in the market, representing a respected yard and jockey. While unraced, the odds suggest notable stable confidence and potential ability. With the field lacking depth and the favourite withdrawn, debutants from strong connections are often competitive in these scenarios[1][4][6].

shortlist.name: Good Banter (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and strong form figures suggest a high level of consistency and current form. Odds reflect market confidence.

shortlist.name: Jr Climbs (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and competitive odds make this runner a strong contender. Recent performances indicate a steady level of ability.

shortlist.name: Song N Dance
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, including a close second last time. Hollie Doyle is a top jockey booking, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are in good form and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Symphony Of Joy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two promising runs, showing improvement and likely to be suited by conditions. Trainer has a good record with similar types and the market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Neptune Street
shortlist.rationale: Unraced but from a top yard with a strong record in this type of race. Market support suggests ability and readiness. Worth respecting given connections and price.

shortlist.name: Arkenstaar
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (SBK), 4.9 (exchange) – solid market position, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins and a strong recent record, indicating sustained improvement. Connections are reliable and the odds reflect genuine market support. No sign of regression in the profile.

shortlist.name: Just Typical
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 (SBK), 5.1 (exchange) – clear market respect, among the favorites
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places in recent starts, showing adaptability and reliability at this level. Trainer is in form and the horse’s profile suggests no need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Susie Sioux
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 (SBK), 5 (exchange) – prominent in the market, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent outings, regularly finishing close up. The booking of a top jockey and solid market support indicate connections expect a strong run. No evidence of decline or need for significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Sarab Star
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.3 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a recent win and a solid third last time, suggesting progressive form. Top of the market and represents a yard in good form. No signs of regression and profile fits a likely improver at this level.

shortlist.name: Arctic Thunder (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.5 exchange (well supported, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive handicaps, including a close fourth last time. Connections are respected and the horse is holding form well. Market support is notable and suggests confidence.

shortlist.name: Storm Free
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 9 exchange (short enough, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and two placed efforts from three starts this season. Still unexposed and open to further improvement. Trainer and jockey combination is strong at this level.

shortlist.name: Mystical Maria
shortlist.odds_note: Solid value at 6/1 (exchange 6.6), not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is consistent, including a win and two places in last four starts. Fahey is a respected trainer and the odds offer fair value for a runner proven at this level. No major improvement needed, and the horse is holding form well.

shortlist.name: Luan (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in market at 4/1 (exchange 6.4), clear contender.
shortlist.rationale: Connections are strong and the horse is lightly raced, suggesting potential for further progress. Recent runs indicate improvement and the market support is notable. No signs of decline and Ferguson’s yard is in good order.

shortlist.name: Naughty Niall
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 5, well-backed and not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a win in recent starts. Williams is a reliable trainer and the horse’s form profile suggests it is competitive at this level. Odds reflect genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Jack Langley
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and several competitive finishes at this level. Odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are reliable for this grade. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: This Time Maybe
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a win and several placings, showing reliability and fitness. Odds reflect strong support. Connections have a good record with similar types. Proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Hashtagnotions (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.95 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last three starts, indicating reliability at this level. Top connections and current odds reflect strong market confidence. No sign of regression in form cycle.

shortlist.name: Ribston Pippin (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.5 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts show upward trajectory and consistency. Odds indicate respect from market. Profile suggests capable of another strong run without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Eternal Solace
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 4/7 (1.73 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut and then ran in a higher grade; top jockey booked; connections in form. The odds reflect clear superiority and the profile suggests no major improvement needed to win here.

shortlist.name: Zighy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 15/8 (3.15 exchange), clear of the rest.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with three solid runs, including two seconds; trainer and jockey both reliable at this level. Closest rival to the favourite and should run to form again.

shortlist.name: Kilkenny Warrior (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out, indicating peak condition. Connections are strong and the market support is significant. Recent improvement and proven ability at this level make him the most likely winner.

shortlist.name: Uncertainty (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this grade with multiple placings. Trainer in good form and the horse is holding its level. Market position reflects realistic winning chance if the favorite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Indian Spirit (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won last time out and showing consistent recent figures. Represents a strong yard and has a reliable jockey. Odds indicate strong market confidence and value relative to rivals.

shortlist.name: Saxonia
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 4.7 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Saxonia arrives in excellent form, winning two of last three starts and consistently finishing in the frame. The booking of Oisin Murphy is a major positive, and the current odds reflect strong market support. Connections are in form and the profile is progressive for this grade.

shortlist.name: North View
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: North View is holding his form well in competitive handicaps and has been running consistently in higher grades. The Boughey/Loughnane combination is respected, and the odds indicate he is well-fancied without being overbet. Recent efforts suggest he remains competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Spitzbergen (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, proven fitness and reliability, top connections, and strong market support. No signs of decline and holds class edge over field.

shortlist.name: Kyoto (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Represents leading trainer and jockey combination, well-backed in market despite lack of public form, suggesting strong stable confidence and potential ability. Connections and odds justify inclusion.

shortlist.name: Kiniro
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Kiniro is the most consistent in the field, regularly placing and running well in recent starts. The booking of top jockey Oisin Murphy and a trainer in good form further strengthen the case. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability for this grade.

shortlist.name: Sturlasson (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support: 15/8 SBK, 3.4 exchange (clear favourite).
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with improving form profile; latest win signals peak condition. Connections are reliable and odds indicate strong confidence from market. No signs of decline and well placed for repeat success.

shortlist.name: Hedge Fund (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market: 11/4 SBK, 5.5 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with solid recent form and proven ability at this level. Trainer is adept at placing horses to win in handicaps. Odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Gold Star Hero (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back shows capability; connections are respected and horse remains competitive at this grade. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven winning form.

shortlist.name: Un Sens A La Vie (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 1/2 SBK, 1.54 exchange (clear favourite, very short odds)
shortlist.rationale: Won sole start to date, representing a top yard with a strong record at this level. The combination of proven winning form, leading connections, and a significant gap in the market to the rest of the field makes this runner the clear standout. No evidence of needing major improvement and profiles as the most likely winner.

shortlist.name: Pioneer Pete
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 6.6 exchange (solid second choice in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placed form in both starts, suggesting reliability and a good base level of ability. Trained and ridden by a respected team. While needing to improve to beat the favourite, he is the most credible alternative and is priced accordingly. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Country Park (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts, including a recent second. The O'Neill yard is in good form and the jockey is reliable. The horse is proven at this level and distance, and the odds are fair for a leading contender. No major improvement needed—just a repeat of recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Stumps Or Slips (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won three of last five starts, showing clear progression. The trainer and jockey are both in excellent form. The horse is clearly improving and has already shown it can win at this level. The odds are slightly shorter than the favorite, but the upward trajectory in form justifies inclusion.

shortlist.name: Indemnity (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/8 (exchange 2.46), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win on seasonal return, suggesting further improvement likely. Top jockey and trainer combination adds confidence. No signs of regression in form.

shortlist.name: Forget The Way
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 9/4 (exchange 4.8), solid support.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, placed on last two starts and proven ability to win at this level. Odds reflect strong chance, and no major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Ruler Of The River (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/5 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with progressive form, trained by Fergal O'Brien who excels with improving types at this level. The horse comes off a win and has shown ability to handle similar conditions. Odds indicate strong market confidence and connections are reliable.

shortlist.name: Tankardstown Diva (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Tom Ellis is a respected trainer in this sphere and the market keeps her competitive. No signs of decline in form and should be suited by race conditions.

shortlist.name: Nickelforce (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and fitness. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No signs of regression in recent runs, and profile fits a horse ready to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Lermoos Legend
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with a string of seconds and two wins before a respectable fourth last time. Proven at this class, and the Bowen team is in good form. The horse's profile is of a reliable, in-form chaser who holds his form well.

shortlist.name: Independent Jimmy
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two seconds in last five starts, indicating reliability and peak fitness. Trained by Donald McCain, a respected handler at this level, and ridden by Theo Gillard who has a strong record for the yard. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a proven performer.

shortlist.name: I Am Rocco
shortlist.rationale: Placed in all three runs this season, showing consistent improvement and readiness to win. Tom Ellis is an adept trainer, and Jack Andrews is a capable jockey in these events. Odds indicate strong market respect and suggest the horse is expected to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Cracks Speed (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Well-supported in the market as clear favourite, indicating strong confidence from connections and punters. Richard Hughes is a respected trainer and Brendan Powell a capable jockey. No negative form indicators, and the price suggests this runner is expected to be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Luna Grace
shortlist.rationale: Consistently well-backed, representing top dual trainers with a strong record at this type of track. Market position suggests stable confidence. No major negatives in profile, and connections are known for placing horses well in similar contests.

shortlist.name: Alobayyah
shortlist.rationale: Last time out winner with elite connections. Haggas/Marquand combination operating at peak form. The '1' indicates recent victory, and despite the '8' showing a poor run prior, the class of trainer suggests horse has found form. Odds reflect market confidence in resuming winning ways.

shortlist.name: Antrim
shortlist.rationale: Gosden stable represents world-class training. Recent form shows consistency with third last time out, suggesting improvement trajectory. Doyle partnership adds further strength. The '3' indicates competitive placing in quality company. Odds offer value given elite connections and progressive form profile.

shortlist.name: Tyraxes (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Placed third on debut, showing immediate ability. Balding yard excels with developing horses. Single run suggests untapped potential and room for natural progression. McDonald booking indicates stable confidence. Odds provide speculative value for lightly-raced type with scope.

shortlist.name: Royal Blaze
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed efforts indicate peak form; proven ability to win at this level. Jockey is reliable and odds offer solid value for a runner with winning form and consistency.

shortlist.name: Jack Sparowe (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time out signals improvement and readiness. Top jockey booking and market support suggest strong connections and confidence. Form is trending upward, making this a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Molinari (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and wins earlier in the season. Remains competitive at this level and odds are fair for a horse with proven ability and reliability.

shortlist.name: Starmade (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a 3rd and 2nd in last two starts, suggesting imminent breakthrough. Top connections and clear market leader. Recent form is reliable and indicates readiness to win at this level.

shortlist.name: Capitalization (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with solid recent form, always in the mix. Booking of James Doyle is a positive. Market support and proven ability to compete at this level make him a strong contender if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Fizzy Cristal
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid placings and a close second last time out. Trained by Richard Fahey, a proven operator at this level, and partnered by a reliable jockey. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Somebody (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in the frame at this grade, with multiple seconds and a recent run pattern suggesting reliability. Trainer and jockey are both capable at this level. Odds reflect solid support and realistic winning chance without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Rain Cap
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes and a win in the last six starts. Proven ability to compete at this level and holds peak fitness. Market support confirms strong chance.

shortlist.name: Flash The Dash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts ago and competitive in similar company. Trainer in good form and odds reflect realistic winning chance. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Medway Queen (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid fourths and a close-up finish last time. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline and likely to be at peak fitness for this contest.

shortlist.name: Ravishing Beauty
shortlist.rationale: Proven consistency with multiple wins and places in recent starts. Reliable connections and competitive odds indicate genuine market respect. Form suggests she remains in good heart and should be involved at the finish.

shortlist.name: Raft Up (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5.2, SBK 11/1 (shorter on exchange, indicating market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent placings and a win in last 8 starts. Market support on the exchange suggests confidence. Jockey Joe Fanning is experienced and reliable at this venue.
shortlist.confidence: Strong each-way contender; solid form and market signals.

shortlist.name: Raatea
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 5.9, SBK 11/2 (well found in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Has run in higher class races and now drops in grade. Trainer Julie Camacho is in good form. Recent runs suggest fitness and potential to bounce back at this level.
shortlist.confidence: Win contender if returning to best; respected on class drop.

shortlist.name: Yes I'm Mali
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level earlier in the season, with a 2nd and 4th in competitive fields. Trainer Richard Fahey is adept at placing horses at Newcastle. Recent form slightly below best but capable of bouncing back.
shortlist.confidence: Place chance; proven at the track and in the grade.

shortlist.name: Second Fiddle (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, indicating strong current ability and confidence. The odds reflect market support and dominance in the field. Connections are in good order, and the recent form is the best in the race, suggesting minimal improvement needed for another win.

shortlist.name: Mrbluesky (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, with several respectable finishes in competitive handicaps. Trainer and jockey are both proven at Newcastle. While not winning recently, the horse has been running well in better company and should be competitive if reproducing best form.

shortlist.name: One More Bottle
shortlist.rationale: Has been holding form well with multiple placings and a win in recent starts. Consistency at this level and odds suggest the market expects another strong run. No major improvement required to contend for the win.

shortlist.name: Prairie Girl (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, hitting the frame last two starts and showing improvement. Top jockey booking in Shane Foley adds confidence. Short odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Spirit Of Eagles (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with multiple placings at this level. Reliable recent form and proven ability to compete in similar company. Jockey G. M. Ryan is a positive booking. Odds offer fair value for a horse likely to be in the mix.

shortlist.name: Valiant Force (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes after a string of competitive efforts. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline in form and proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Fandom
shortlist.rationale: Trainer is highly respected and the horse has shown ability at this class. Recent form is mixed but includes a win and a solid fifth last time, suggesting potential to improve. Odds are fair for the profile.

shortlist.name: Fleur De Rose (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in competitive races, trained by a top yard with strong Dundalk record. Current odds reflect solid market support and suggest genuine winning chance. Connections are reliable and horse is not exposed, with scope for further improvement at this level.

shortlist.name: A La Dure
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, showing improvement with each run. Trainer is adept at placing horses at Dundalk and the odds indicate strong market confidence. Not a longshot and has shown ability to compete at this class.

shortlist.name: Ocean Manifest (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes from last three starts, suggesting readiness to win. Short odds reflect strong market confidence. No need for major improvement and profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Phoenix Pairc (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with three consecutive placed efforts, indicating reliability and fitness. Trainer and jockey are respected at this venue. Odds offer fair value for a horse knocking on the door.

shortlist.name: Senti Qua (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals improvement and ability to compete at this level. Connections are capable and market support is notable. Needs only to repeat latest to be involved.

shortlist.name: Shavasi (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 3.2 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with a progressive profile, trained by a top yard and partnered by a leading jockey. The latest win suggests peak form and the odds indicate strong market confidence. Connections are highly reliable at Dundalk.

shortlist.name: Aviatrice (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 3.85 exchange (well found in the market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with multiple recent placings and a strong overall profile for this grade. Proven at the track and distance, and her odds reflect sustained support. Connections have a good record with similar types.

shortlist.name: Empress Artemis (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent, with a string of recent wins and places. Top jockey-trainer combination, and the form line shows she holds her level well. Market position is justified by her reliability and connections.

shortlist.name: Micasso (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (5/2 SBK, 2.52 exchange), clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a runner-up finish last time out, indicating improvement and readiness. Top jockey booking in C. T. Keane adds confidence. Connections are reliable and the odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Super Exceed (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third place shows competitive form and ability to hit the frame. Jockey D. B. McMonagle is a positive booking. Trainer Mullins is respected at Dundalk. Odds suggest strong support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Johnny's Oasis
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth and third place finishes indicate upward trajectory and reliability at this level. Trainer McGuinness is adept with Dundalk runners. Market position confirms expectations for a strong run.

shortlist.name: Sidiza (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 2.8 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a solid reappearance third after a break. Trained by Dermot Weld, a top operator at Dundalk, and partnered by a reliable jockey. Recent form suggests further improvement likely and market confidence is strong.

shortlist.name: Pearl Jewel (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.6 exchange (well found in market, clear second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this level earlier in the season, with a win and placed efforts. Recent form a bit patchy but has run well at Dundalk before. Top jockey booking in Colin Keane is a notable positive. Represents value as the main threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Beauty Generation (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 4 exchange (third in market, not dismissed)
shortlist.rationale: Has struggled in higher grades but recent fifth suggests a return to form. Drops in class here and is trained by Jessica Harrington, who excels with this type. Jockey booking is strong and odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Cinammon Coco (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive recent form (4th, then 3rd, then 1st) indicates peak condition. Trained by Joseph O'Brien, a leading yard, and partnered by a reliable jockey. Short odds reflect strong market confidence and suitability at this level.

shortlist.name: Hopes Are High (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent and progressive form (1st, 3rd, 1st) suggests ongoing improvement. Odds are fair for a runner with proven winning ability and no major negatives in profile. Represents value as the main threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Eastmore
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two wins from last three starts (2-1-2). Charles Byrnes yard in excellent form and horse appears to have found its optimum level. Consistent performer showing improvement trajectory with back-to-back placed efforts before recent win.

shortlist.name: Watching The Clock (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with solid recent form showing consistent competitiveness. Last run winner stepping up in grade. Pattern of 3-5-4-8-1 shows improvement trend culminating in recent victory. Connections targeting this race with confidence reflected in odds.

shortlist.name: Bearami Creek (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form turnaround with win last time out (1) followed by placed effort (4). Peter Fahey stable has horse racing with renewed confidence after earlier struggles. Distance and conditions appear suitable based on recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Derry Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second-place finish shows ability at this level despite fall earlier in campaign. Emmet Mullins renowned for placing horses strategically. Odds suggest genuine winning chance with improved run expected.

shortlist.name: Glen Kiln (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with a recent win and unseated last time, but overall profile is progressive at this level. Short odds reflect clear market confidence and recent form is superior to rivals. Connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Wendrock (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer in competitive races, now returns fresh for a top yard with a leading jockey. Odds are fair for a horse with solid place credentials and potential to improve off a break.

shortlist.name: Reiki Revolution (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last seven starts. Proven ability to compete at this level, trained by a respected yard, and partnered by a capable jockey. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Youre A Derry Girl (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with two seconds and a fourth in last four runs, indicating competitiveness and consistency at this grade. Market support is strong, and profile suggests she is likely to be in the mix again.

shortlist.name: Demanding Gerry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Connections are in good order and the horse is holding peak form, which is crucial for handicapping at this level.

shortlist.name: Pourquoi Poi (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced profile with top jockey booking (J. W. Kennedy) and a progressive last run (5th) after two unplaced efforts. Likely to improve further and market support is notable.

shortlist.name: Rising Dust (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, winning last time out and previously runner-up. Consistent profile, proven at this level, and represents a shrewd stable. Current odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Duke Silver (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner with a progressive profile and top connections. Consistent in the frame this season, suggesting reliability. Odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Sign From Above (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive last-time-out winner, indicating return to form. Connections are adept at placing horses in winnable races. Market support suggests confidence in back-to-back wins.

shortlist.name: Easter Bonnet (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Top connections (Mullins stable, leading Irish trainer), strong market support, and likely to be fit and ready for debut. Odds reflect confidence, but no exposed form to assess. Still, the yard's record with newcomers is exceptional.

shortlist.name: Prophetess Miriam (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Already racecourse experience with a promising second-place finish. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the form figure suggests she is ready to win. Odds offer some value against the favourite.

shortlist.name: Courageous Cleo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Another newcomer from a top yard (Gordon Elliott). Market respects chance, but no exposed form. Could be anything, but needs to improve on debut to win.

shortlist.name: Fancy Du Pecos Aa (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early market, not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top French jumps trainer Francois Nicolle, who excels with young horses at Bordeaux. Jockey Angelo Zuliani is a leading rider in the region. Market support and strong connections suggest readiness and ability, even with no published form.

shortlist.name: Loulou Du Lys (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong trainer connections and potential recent form

shortlist.name: Dersky (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong trainer connections and potential recent form

shortlist.name: Jaroussky Aa (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early exchange and bookmaker markets; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the leading Lageneste & Macaire stable, which is highly respected in French jumps racing. Johnny Charron is a top jockey for the yard, and their runners are typically well-prepared for debut or early starts. Market support suggests strong stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Dream On Pompadour (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Angelo Zuliani is a leading jockey, and the Lagarde stable is known for readying horses for these provincial contests. The combination is respected, and market position indicates expectations of a bold run.

shortlist.name: Kobe De La Brunie (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the betting; considered a principal contender.
shortlist.rationale: Lucas Zuliani is a capable rider and the Gourdon yard is in form. Kobe De La Brunie is attracting market support, suggesting the stable expects a strong performance.

shortlist.name: Lilac Snow (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a third last time out, indicating readiness and reliability. Connections are experienced, and the odds suggest strong market confidence. No signs of needing major improvement, making this runner the standout on both form and value.

shortlist.name: Golden Operator (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Clear market leader at 1.36, well clear of the field.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 2nd and 3rd in last two starts, indicating strong current condition. Trained by S. G. Tarry, a leading local trainer, and partnered by top jockey Craig Zackey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and suggest minimal improvement needed for victory.

shortlist.name: Power Of Pearls (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Solidly backed at 1.61, among the shortest in the field.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is consistent and competitive, with multiple placings including a 2nd and 3rd in last four runs. Connections are reliable, and the horse has shown ability to compete at this level. Odds indicate strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Ethical (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are respected locally. No need for major improvement to contend at this level.

shortlist.name: Asiah's Tiara (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly in the frame with several recent placings, suggesting a competitive profile. Form is solid for this grade and odds reflect strong market support.

shortlist.name: War Of Kingdoms (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins and a second from three starts, indicating strong current form and potential for further improvement. Top connections and market support reinforce confidence.

shortlist.name: Bjorn Ironside (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break to win latest start, suggesting readiness and ability at this level. Consistent form and leading jockey/trainer combination add to appeal.

shortlist.name: Rondebosch (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid placings in competitive fields. Stable in excellent form and market position signals strong expectations.

shortlist.name: Curtiss Condor (Saf)
shortlist.trainer: J. J. van Vuuren, South Africa
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive with a win two starts back and a solid placing last time. Trainer is respected and jockey is experienced. Connections are in good order and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: American Rebel (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings in last five starts. Trainer and jockey combination has delivered results. Horse is reliable and has shown ability to compete strongly in similar company.

shortlist.name: Poplar Park (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange odds 1.61, indicating strong market support.
shortlist.rationale: Poplar Park arrives in top form, winning two of last three starts and showing consistency at this level. The combination of Muzi Yeni (a leading jockey) and R. R. Sage (trainer with solid local record) adds confidence. Recent form figures suggest the horse is peaking and well-suited to current conditions.

shortlist.name: Warning Sound (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Warning Sound has shown ability to win and place consistently, with two wins in last five starts and competitive efforts in higher grade. S. G. Tarry is a top trainer at Vaal, and Kabelo Matsunyane is a reliable jockey. The horse’s recent form and connections suggest readiness and class for this contest.

shortlist.name: Twostep Queen (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Twostep Queen is progressive, winning last time out and showing improvement through recent runs. Trainer S. J. Gray has a good strike rate with similar types at Vaal. The horse’s upward trajectory and recent win make her a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Mamlambo (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with two wins and a second from last three starts, indicating peak condition. Connections are reliable, and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline or need for improvement, making this runner the most likely winner.

shortlist.name: Hazy Dazy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a third from only two starts, suggesting untapped potential and current good form. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the odds indicate market respect. No major improvement needed; could be the main danger to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Nuclear Force (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with third-place finish last start (3) following a win two starts back (1). Consistent placings in five of last eight starts. Trainer E. Verdonese and jockey Callan Murray represent capable connections. Horse appears on upward trajectory with winning form demonstrated.

shortlist.name: Cartagena (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent form pattern showing three consecutive wins (111) in middle of sequence. Recent runs of 3-6-3 suggest horse is finding consistency again after brief dip. Multiple wins demonstrate ability at this level. Experienced trainer H. E. Adamson with proven jockey Marco V'rensburg.

shortlist.name: Royal Mazarin (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with third last start and consistent placings throughout sequence (2-4-1). Has winning form and placed in six of nine recorded starts. Trainer J. A. Soma pairs with competent jockey Chase Maujean. Shows versatility and reliability across various conditions.
